Councils minimise IT cuts to drive through savings>> Computer Weekly Cuts to IT budgets in local councils have been minimised in an attempt by local authorities to drive efficiency savings through technology, according to the latest report from Socitm. "Budgets made available for ICT functions declined by 2.6% in 2010 compare to the previous year, while borrowing to invest in ICT doubled. In 2009 budgets shrank by 11%. This year's figure was much less than expected, said the body for public sector IT professionals. Donald Rumsfeld : Maybe We Needed More Troops by Staff President Bush U.S. Defense Donald Rumsfeld is conceding "it's possible" too few troops were sent to invade Iraq. In a war, many things cost lives, Donald Rumsfeld told ABC in an interview to be broadcast on "Nightline" Monday. President Bush has written that the troop level in Iraq was "the most important failure in the execution of the war."
